task_summary: Pick up the pan using perception, approach, alignment, and a top grasp; ensure stable grasp.

task_long_description.overview: This episode captures a sawyer robot locating and picking up a white pan with a dark handle from a blue surface, observed via a wrist-mounted camera. The robot must detect the pan, approach from above, align itself precisely, and execute a grasp with its gripper configured for a top approach. The plan ensures visibility, precise alignment, and secure grasp as key constraints.
preconditions: Pan is on a detectable surface within reachable workspace.
Robot gripper is empty and operational.
Camera feed is active for object detection.
stepwise_plan: Check if the pan is visible; if not, scan for it.
Detect the pan for precise pose estimation.
Move end-effector above the pan with a safe vertical offset.
Approach and align vertically towards the pan.
Open gripper to a suitable width.
Compute feasible top grasp pose on the pan.
Move to and execute the grasp.
success_criteria: Pan is securely held by the gripper.
No slippage is observed after lifting.
Grasp pose and alignment are as computed.
failure_and_recovery: If pan is not initially visible, scan up to 3 times.
If grasp is unstable, abort and reset or retry.
Failure to align results in abort.
Fallback to perception routines if detection fails.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the robot has picked up the pan and grasp stability is verified.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks whether the pan is visible to the perception system.
Scans environment in a spiral pattern up to 3 times for pan.
Attempts detection and localization of the pan.
Moves end-effector above the pan by 0.05m.
Approaches pan vertically and aligns within a 0.005m tolerance.
Opens gripper to 0.08m ready for grasp.
Computes a grasp pose for top grasp of pan, stores as std_top.
Executes grasp at computed pose with top strategy.
Checks if the grasp on the pan is stable post-grasp.

failure_modes: Pan not found in search area
recovery_strategy: Retry scan up to 3 times if pan is not initially visible.
Abort and reset routine if grasp fails or instability is detected.
Fallbacks to re-perceive if alignment or detection errors occur.
assumptions: The contact sheet frames show a top-down pick of a white pan with a dark handle consistent with the task.
Handle treated as part of the pan; no conflicting cues with the instruction.
Exact pan model assumed based on visual; no other distractor objects visible.

expected_success_criteria: Pan firmly in gripper at final frame
BT tracks all intended perception and manipulation phases
